definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)
tomorrow morning/the following morning
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
Mincho font

sentences.english: His policy of overseas contacts was generally followed by his successors in Ming Dyn …
sentences.chinese: 明朝后代基本上沿用了太祖的海外交往政策。

sentences.english: Ming court belied that its greatest challenges and opportunities were at home.
sentences.chinese: 明朝朝廷认识到最大的挑战和机遇是在国内。

sentences.english: Xi'an City Wall dates back to the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 西安古城墙始建于明朝。

sentences.english: From the Yongle Emperor onwards, 13 Ming Dynasty Emperors were buried in this area.
sentences.chinese: 自永乐帝开始，明朝十三陵共埋葬了十三位皇帝。

sentences.english: The turning point of the Ming Dynasty from prosperity to decline was the reign of Emperor Shenzong.
sentences.chinese: 明朝由盛到衰的转折点是明神宗的统治。

sentences.english: Hu Yinlin of the late Ming Dynasty made quite a contribution to literary theory and studies.
sentences.chinese: 明朝后期的胡应麟在文学理论及治学方面颇有建树。

sentences.english: Zhenyuan ordained at East Bridge in rivers and mountains, was built in the Ming Dynasty Hongwu years.
sentences.chinese: 位于镇远县城东中河山，始建于明朝洪武年间。

sentences.english: Since building up the country, Ming Dynasty had always suffered the Japanese pirates' invading and harassing.
sentences.chinese: 从建国开始，明朝一直深受倭寇的侵扰。

sentences.english: It was especially popular for trading during the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 纸币在明朝的商贸交易中尤受欢迎。

sentences.english: They are all famous virtuous scholars of the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是明朝著名的清流。

sentences.english: The architectural character of the building is typical of the Ming Dynasty. Notice the black glazed tiles.
sentences.chinese: 其建筑形式是典型的明朝风格，注意黑色的琉璃瓦。

sentences.english: Finally, a Manchu invasion ended the Ming regime.
sentences.chinese: 最终，满族的入侵结束了明朝的统治。

sentences.english: Theart of embroidery had its heyday in the Ming and Qing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 在明朝和清朝，刺绣艺术达到全盛期。

sentences.english: The Ming dynasty palace of the twentieth century, corruption.
The museum displayed several items from the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆展出数件中国明朝时期的物品。

sentences.english: Li Hengfu proposal please reinforcements of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 李恒福提议请明朝援军。

definition: Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
late Ming/first half of the 17th century
Ming Taizu, Temple name of first Ming emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
the Ming dynasty (1368-1644)
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
early years
Song Dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]
Tang dynasty (618-907)
Ming Wuzong, temple name of eleventh Ming emperor Zhengde 正德[Zheng4 de2]
